title: --report-status has no effect
body:
a sibling of #5581  ?

testing #5517 where I would like to suppress any (well, non errors) status reporting since not pertinent but it is always there:
```
$> datalad --report-status failure foreach -d ~/datalad -r --fulfilled true -R2 -J4 --chpwd true --o-s pass-through pwd
/home/yoh/datalad
/home/yoh/datalad/allen-brain-observatory
/home/yoh/datalad/centerforopenneuroscience
/home/yoh/datalad/allen-brain-observatory/visual-coding-neuropixels
/home/yoh/datalad/conp-dataset
/home/yoh/datalad/crcns

/home/yoh/datalad/dbic

/home/yoh/datalad/dbic/QA

/home/yoh/datalad/hcp-openaccess/HCP1200/198047
/home/yoh/datalad/labs
/home/yoh/datalad/hcp-openaccess/HCP1200/569965
/home/yoh/datalad/openfmri

/home/yoh/datalad/openfmri/ds000105
/home/yoh/datalad/openneuro
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad (dataset)
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/allen-brain-observatory (dataset)
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/centerforopenneuroscience (dataset)
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/allen-brain-observatory/visual-coding-neuropixels (dataset)
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/conp-dataset (dataset)
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/crcns (dataset)

foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/crcns/aa-1 (dataset)
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/crcns/lgn-1 (dataset)
foreach(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/dbic (dataset)
/home/yoh/datalad/openneuro/ds000001ssed]
/home/yoh/datalad/openneuro/ds000003
/home/yoh/datalad/openneuro/ds000002
/home/yoh/datalad/openneuro/ds000005

  [23 similar messages have been suppressed]
action summary:
  foreach (ok: 33)
```

NB there is also that `/home/yoh/datalad/openneuro/ds000001ssed]` which is I guess due to use of `-J` here... made a note in #5517
